title: Instructional Design for Fostering Caring Relationships in Online Mathematics Classes: Integrating Mathematical Problem-Solving Processes with Emotional Support

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics curriculum content (algebra, geometry, statistics, etc.) and experience operating online learning platforms (LMS), with a basic understanding of mathematical problem-solving processes
context.additional_context: Process for pre-service teachers to develop strategies for building caring relationships with learners in online math instruction. Emphasizes instructional design that considers the interplay between mathematical concept comprehension and emotional support.

learning_goals: Propose ≥3 strategies applying Noddings’ four caring elements (attentiveness, sensitivity, responsiveness, competence) to mathematical problem-solving (e.g., customized feedback via error analysis, emotional encouragement during graph interpretation)

Develop ≥5 communication message examples addressing learners’ emotional needs in online math classes (e.g., frustration-mitigating expressions during equation-solving, motivational phrases in geometry explanations)

Create instructional designs analyzing formative assessment data (e.g., quiz results, assignment submission patterns) in LMS environments to provide personalized feedback (e.g., error pattern diagnosis, concept-level tailored resources)

resources: LMS platform (bulletin board, quiz, video lecture functionality)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
